job_description:
Title: Manager, Data Science – Personalization

Salary: Up to $180,000 + 15% bonus

Location: Office based - Michigan

Sector: FMCG

Job Description

Forsyth Barnes Data Science recruitment team is working with a top FMCG organization to find an experienced Data Science Manager to lead ML initiatives for impactful Personalization. The ideal candidate possesses a proven track record in building personalization models and algorithms within a business context, demonstrating adaptability and expertise. Responsibilities include guiding the end-to-end development of ML models, particularly in areas such as Customer Lifetime Value (LTV), Churn Prediction, and Promo Recommendation Engine.

Manager, Data Science - Main Responsibilities
• Thought Leader: Provide consistent, high-quality innovative ideas, serving as a technical authority in Personalization Data Science.
• Lead from the Front: Proactively devise solutions and approaches with infectious energy and passion, ensuring necessary resources and expertise for team development.
• Stay Informed: Continuously monitor industry trends in marketing personalization, digital innovation, and machine learning to guide internal strategies.
• Data Navigation: Quickly understand and work with data in various forms to guide the development of ML models.
• Develop and Ship Models: Contribute to the development and deployment of models such as LTV, Churn Prediction, and Promo Recommendation Engine.
• Technical Insights: Apply deep technical insights for selecting and employing machine learning personalization algorithms.

Manager, Data Science – Requirements:
• Must have strong technical experience utilizing Python, SQL, PySpark
• Experience building LTV model, churn prediction and recommendation models
• Experience leading team of 2+
• Any experience within the consumer space would be advantageous

Qualifications: Must have strong technical experience utilizing Python, SQL, PySpark
Experience building LTV model, churn prediction and recommendation models
Any experience within the consumer space would be advantageous
